Key Match Events: Lautaro Martinez scored two goals for Argentina, one in the 47th minute and another in the 86th minute.
Argentina won the match 2-0 against Peru.
Argentina and Canada progressed to the knockout stage, while Chile and Peru were eliminated.
Pre-Game Insights: Lionel Messi did not play due to a thigh injury.
Lionel Scaloni, Argentina's manager, was serving a one-match touchline ban.
Argentina were expected to make wholesale changes to their starting XI as they had already secured progression to the quarter-final.
Opta prediction favored Argentina to win with a 75.8% probability.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami Gardens, Florida.
There was a 30% chance of precipitation at kickoff time with a temperature of 87°F.
Peru faced the possibility of being eliminated without winning a single game for the first time since 1995.
Lautaro Martinez had scored five times in his last five international games.
Argentina recorded a total of 18 shots on goal in their first two games, more than the sum of all three other teams in Group A.
Argentina aimed to win all three of their group-stage games at Copa America for the third time this century.
